description: First floor side extension incorporating rear roof extension and three roof lights; conversion of attached garage into habitable space involving replacement of garage door with window; rear roof extension; insertion of three roof lights to main roof space and removal of existing roof light
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with:
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and the St Marks and Canal Conservation Area Appraisal (2007) and Management Plan (2007). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect visual and residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and the St Marks and Canal Conservation Area Appraisal (2007) and Management Plan (2007). | No trees, shrubs or hedges adjacent to it shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To secure the protection throughout the time that development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which are of ecological and amenity value. | The roof lights hereby approved shall be conservation style and flush with the roof slopes that they are to be installed within.

Reason: To protect the character and visual amenity of the St Marks and Canal Conservation Area in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and the St Marks and Canal Conservation Area Appraisal (2007) and Management Plan (2007).
